elements.title: General Motors Technical Center (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the opening of the General Motors Technical Center (pictured) featured an appearance by Indonesia's president and a speech from the US president?

elements.title: Tareq Baconi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that author Tareq Baconi, after studying MENA water scarcity and Hamas, wrote a memoir about queer identity, family displacement, and political awakening?

elements.title: a former train station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a New York railroad once operated a special train to a former train station so that people could see model trains?

elements.title: Leon Russianoff (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Leon Russianoff never took a college music lesson, but an obituary stated that he was "considered by many to be the Godfather of American clarinetists"?

elements.title: an American government database (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an American government database was named after a rock band?

elements.title: Kaiten no Albus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the author of Kaiten no Albus did not decide the protagonist's objective until after the first chapter was written?

elements.title: a Florida TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Florida TV station was named after Columbia Pictures, even though a merger with that company fell through?

elements.title: Gemma Hayter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gemma Hayter was inspired to return to playing darts after eight years when her friend became world champion?

elements.title: a book (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that multiple police raids failed to retrieve a book that was once valued at more than US$900 million?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
